result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chase E Thistle

defendant.name: Thistle, Chase E
defendant.address: 403 Jackson Street, Columbia County Jail, Portage, WI 53901

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on 12-8-17 filed by court reporter Chris Champeau

Cases called: 15CF526 & 15CF324, Defendant Chase E Thistle in court, in custody with attorney Edward J. Hunt.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PSI received. Correction noted by Atty. Hunt. Victim impact statements addressed. Exhibits 1&2 marked. Statements by victim's father, mother & sister. Sentencing recommendations put on the record. Statement by defendant. Court sentenced defendant to 13 years prison, consisting of 3 years confinement and 10 years extended supervision, consecutive to any other sentence. No contact victim's family or co-defendants. Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. Not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid Rx. Not possess drug paraphernalia. $13,913 restitution, joint and several. $518 costs. Submit DNA sample. Defendant is eligible for Challenge Academy, is eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Jail credit: 711 days. 15CF324 read in and dismissed.10:10 a.m/11:53 a.m.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Defendant Chase E Thistle in court, in custody with attorney Edward J. Hunt.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 15CF324 and 15CF526.   Attorney Hunt requested sequester of witnesses.  State had no objection with the exception of Court officer Det. J. Kocozsky. In 15CF526- State called witness (Det. J. Kocozsky).  Witness sworn.  Direct examination.  Cross examination.  Redirect.  Recross.  Witness excused.  State called witness (Deputy L. Wagner).  Witness sworn.  Direct examination started.  Atty Hunt objected to next witness without closing argument of 15CF526.  Court found probable cause.  Defendant bound over.  Atty Hunt held argument with Court over probable cause being found.  15CF324 called by Court.  State recalled witness (Deputy L. Wagner).  Direct examination continued.  No cross examination.  State called witness (Det. J. Kocozsky). Direct examination.  No cross examination.  Closing arguments for this case.  Attorney Hunt requested 15CF324 be dismissed.  State gave argument.  Court denied the request.  Found probable cause, bound defendant over for further proceedings.  Information filed, reading waived in both cases. Defendant stood mute to 15CF526. Court entered not guilty plea. Bond continued.  Attorney Hunt requested a status date be set.  That will be set with Br. 3 JA by attorney Hunt.  In 15CF324  Defendant stood mute to all counts.  Court entered not guilty pleas.  Attorney Hunt requested a status date.  That will be set with Br. 2 JA for after 15CF526's status conference.  9:58/11:38
